newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Car cover turnaround boosts Stad Rotterdam pre-tax.
newsitem.headline: Car cover turnaround boosts Stad Rotterdam pre-tax.

text.p: Insurer Stad Rotterdam said on Thursday pre-tax profits at its non-life business jumped 34.3 percent due mainly to the turnaround in car insurance.
Pre-tax non-life profits rose to 121.1 million guilders in 1996 from a year-earlier 90.2 million, it said.

"The main reason for this rise was the improvement in the motor insurance product group which recorded an increase in premiums (+11.4 percent) and a relatively small rise in the cost of claims," it said. Motor insurance profit rose to 8.5 million guilders from a loss of 15.5 million.
Non-life premium income also rose sharply to 1.6 billion guilders from 1.4 billion, boosted by 90 million guilders in premiums from absenteeism cover.

This new type of cover was introduced to insure companies against the costs of employee absenteeism. Under amendments to Dutch law aimed at curbing worker absenteeism, Dutch employers are now constrained to pay the first two to six weeks of workers' salaries when they report sick.
Life insurance premium income edged up 4.7 percent to 1.6 billion guilders, Stad Rotterdam said.
It said new business in single-premium life policies rose to 385 million guilders from a year-earlier 346 million, despite the low level of interest rates.
Stad Rotterdam said profit developments in its life insurance business were "satisfactory". Pre-tax profits rose 10.5 percent to 117.5 million guilders from a year-earlier 106.3 million.
Its banking activities posted a pre-tax profit increase of 18.4 percent to 29.6 million guilders in 1996, it said.
The insurer earlier reported 1996 net profits up 17.6 percent at 156.9 million guilders.
